etymology.description: 明 ‘bright; famous’ + 星 ‘star’ = celebrity; luminary (lit. bright star).
etymology.interpretation: Literally “bright star.” By extension, someone who stands out in the public eye, especially in entertainment or sports.

examples.chinese: 她是一位国际知名的电影明星(她是一位國際知名的電影明星)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì yí wèi guójì zhīmíng de diànyǐng míngxīng.
examples.english: She is an internationally renowned movie star.

examples.chinese: 他从普通演员成长为一线明星(他從普通演員成長為一線明星)。
examples.pinyin: Tā cóng pǔtōng yǎnyuán chéngzhǎng wéi yīxiàn míngxīng.
examples.english: He rose from an ordinary actor to a top-tier celebrity.

examples.chinese: 清晨东方的天空出现了一颗明亮的明星(清晨東方的天空出現了一顆明亮的明星)。
examples.pinyin: Qīngchén dōngfāng de tiānkōng chūxiàn le yì kē míngliàng de míngxīng.
examples.english: In the early morning eastern sky, a bright star appeared.
